intro: Hieracium pecuarium, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist to moderately dry conditions. Its leaves are broadly lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium pecuarium is often found in open habitats and can form dense colonies, contributing to the biodiversity of its native environments.
